post_action_types.name: Off-Topic
post_action_types.description: This post is not relevant to the current discussion as defined by the title and first post, and should probably be moved elsewhere.

post_action_types.name: Inappropriate
post_action_types.description: This post contains content that a reasonable person would consider offensive, abusive, to be hateful conduct or a violation of our community guidelines.
post_action_types.short_description: A violation of our community guidelines

post_action_types.name: Spam
post_action_types.description: This post is an advertisement, or vandalism. It is not useful or relevant to the current topic.
post_action_types.short_description: This is an advertisement or vandalism

post_action_types.name: Send @%{username} a message
post_action_types.description: I want to talk to this person directly and personally about their post.
post_action_types.short_description: I want to talk to this person directly and personally about their post.

post_action_types.name: Illegal
post_action_types.description: This post requires staff attention because I believe it contains content that is illegal.

post_action_types.name: Something Else
post_action_types.description: This post requires staff attention for another reason not listed above.
post_action_types.short_description: Requires staff attention for another reason

topic_flag_types.name: Inappropriate
topic_flag_types.description: This topic contains content that a reasonable person would consider offensive, abusive, to be hateful conduct or a violation of our community guidelines.
topic_flag_types.short_description: A violation of our community guidelines

topic_flag_types.name: Spam
topic_flag_types.description: This topic is an advertisement. It is not useful or relevant to this site, but promotional in nature.

topic_flag_types.name: Illegal
topic_flag_types.description: This topic requires staff attention because I believe it contains content that is illegal.

topic_flag_types.name: Something Else
topic_flag_types.description: This topic requires general staff attention based on the guidelines, TOS, or for another reason not listed above.
topic_flag_types.short_description: Requires staff attention for another reason

categories.name: blog
categories.description: Discussion topics generated from the official Discourse Blog. These topics are linked from the bottom of each blog entry where the blog comments would normally be.

categories.name: documentation
categories.description: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.
categories.description_text: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.
categories.description_excerpt: Documentation for how to use Discourse, install and configure sites, and troubleshoot common issues. Includes topics for tutorials, how-tos, general reference and troubleshooting. Topics need to be created in one of the subcategories, and may only be created by trust level 2 and up.

categories.name: bug
categories.description: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.
categories.description_text: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.
categories.description_excerpt: A bug report means something is broken, preventing normal/typical use of Discourse. Do be sure to search prior to submitting bugs. Include repro steps, and only describe one bug per topic please.

categories.topic_template:
What would you like done?

When do you need it done?

What is your budget, in $ USD that you can offer for this task?

<!-- We encourage caution and due diligence when engaging with potential contractors or clients. Verify their credentials, check previous work, and ensure a transparent and legitimate transaction. Always remember, your safety and security in the marketplace is your responsibility. -->

categories.name: plugin
categories.description: A directory of Discourse plugins, both official and third-party.
categories.description_text: A directory of Discourse plugins, both official and third-party.
categories.description_excerpt: A directory of Discourse plugins, both official and third-party.
categories.topic_template:
| | | | | - | - | - | | :information_source: | **Summary** | In a few words, what does this plugin do? | | :hammer_and_wrench: | **Repository Link** | <> | | :open_book: | **Install Guide** | [How to install plugins in Discourse](https://meta.discourse.org/t/install-plugins-in-discourse/19157) |
### Features Describe the major features of the plugin ### Configuration Include detailed steps on how to configure the plugin (include screenshots where necessary) ### CHANGELOG - Add new bullets when major features are committed here ### TODO - Add any #pr-welcome TODO tasks here

categories.name: extras
categories.description: A directory of all extensions & integrations for Discourse which are not Discourse plugins, i.e. a CMS plugin, a browser extension or a native application.

categories.description_excerpt: A directory of all extensions & integrations for Discourse which are not Discourse plugins, i.e. a CMS plugin, a browser extension or a native application.

categories.name: theme
categories.description: Themes are expansive customizations that change multiple elements of the style of your forum design, and often also include additional front-end features.
categories.description_text: Themes are expansive customizations that change multiple elements of the style of your forum design, and often also include additional front-end features.
categories.description_excerpt: Themes are expansive customizations that change multiple elements of the style of your forum design, and often also include additional front-end features.

| :eyeglasses:|**Preview**| PREVIEW_LINK |
| :hammer_and_wrench:|**Repository**| REPOSITORY_LINK |

| :open_book:|**New to Discourse Themes?**| [Beginner’s guide to using Discourse Themes](https://meta.discourse.org/t/beginners-guide-to-using-discourse-themes/91966)

categories.name: forum summaries
categories.description: Stay up-to-date with the pulse of our community through AI-crafted summaries.  This category harnesses the power of artificial intelligence to collate and condense forum activities, providing you with comprehensive yet succinct overviews. From emerging discussions to trending topics, our AI summaries deliver the essence of the Discourse community’s heartbeat, right at your fingertips.
